result.execSummary:
The defendant Gene W Welsher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT; AS TO BOTH COUNTS; with credit for 48 days time served
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 08/21/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. DUE TO FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, COURT WAIVED THE DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE. Any amount remaining due an dowing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Successfully complete "Batters intervention" counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Other than prescribed medication, maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

timeConds.notes: CONCURRENT; STAYED pending a review on 08-21-15

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gene W Welsher in court.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Gene W Welsher in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
At defense counsel request and with no objection from the agent, the 8/21/15 review hearing is rescheduled to 9/25/15 at 1:30 pm.  rmm

Defendant Gene W Welsher in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Angela C.  Court found this matter is a domestic abuse incident and the domestic abuse surcharge applies.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 48 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 48 days time served.  
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days concurrent in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 8/21/15.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Other than prescribed medication, maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  DUE TO FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, COURT WAIVED THE DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gene W Welsher in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea hearing.  Parties would like another date.  Court vacated the 4/13/15 jury trial.  Case is adjourned to  Court advised defendant that the no violent contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Statements made by Angela C.  Court modified the no contact order to a NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER if the victim has the domestic abuse restraining order modified.
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/13/15 in Branch 40 but defendant would like a plea date before that.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Gene W Welsher in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
JUDGE WAGNER FOR JUDGE DALLET.  
Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney Mark Tishberg for attorney Dan Mitchell.

15RM011022  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-03-15

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Gene W Welsher not in court, in custody.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail hearing waived.  Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
At the request of counsel, this matter is rescheduled to 1/30/15 at 8:30 am.  rmm

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: ANGELA C.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gene W Welsher in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Gene W Welsher in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40 due to lower pending case 15CM232.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
